parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.
Rotten, useless, corrupt, depraved. From sepo; rotten, i.e. Worthless.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
Rotten, useless, corrupt, depraved. From sepo; rotten, i.e. Worthless.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
